sentences: Marjorie Helen Orwig (June 3, 1924 â€“ June 14, 2000) better known as Margie Rayburn was an American traditional pop singer.
Rayburn was born in Madera, California, United States, and sang as a member of The Sunnysiders, who had a Top 40 hit in the United States in 1955 with the song "Hey!
Rayburn married Norman Milkin, also a member of the Sunnysiders.
She also had a Top Ten hit of her own in 1957 with the song "I'm Available", which was written by Dave Burgess.
As a songwriter she co-wrote with Milkin the 1963 song "Roman Holiday".
She died on June 14, 2000, in Oceanside, California, at the age of 76.
